Pre-Game Insights: Padres have reminded fans about their zero-tolerance policy for bad behavior ahead of Game 3 due to incidents in Game 2.
Fans threw baseballs in the direction of San Diego left fielder Jurickson Profar and threw trash onto the outfield.
Dodgers starter Jack Flaherty and Padres third baseman Manny Machado directed expletives at each other.
Machado threw a ball into the Dodgers dugout during the Padres' 10-2 win the night before, which Dodgers manager Dave Roberts found bothersome.
Padres manager Mike Shildt praised Machado's professionalism and leadership despite the tension.
